The first set of zeros of the principal value of Y_{n}\left(nz\right) are the points z=y_{n,m}/n , m=1,2,\ldots , on the positive real axis (§10.21(i)).
Secondly, there is a conjugate pair of infinite strings of zeros with asymptotes \Im z=\pm\mathrm{i}a/n , where a=\tfrac{1}{2}\ln 3=0.54931\ldots.
Lastly, there are two conjugate sets, with n zeros in each set, that are asymptotically close to the boundary of \mathbf{K} as n\to\infty.
